comment.author: 39312862@N00
comment._content: Any chance some of your lower resolution uploads, like this group and the Ansel Adams, will be upgraded to higher resolution? I know sometimes libraries made these lower resolution scans a long time ago before high resolution equipment was widely available.

comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content: Eric in SF, Thanks for your question. The lower resolution (72 dpi) uploads are the same versions available in our online catalog (the Archival Research Catalog, or ARC www.archives.gov/research/arc/ ). Most of these were digitized in the late 1990s. Photographs and documents that have been digitized more recently are almost always available in the catalog at a higher resolution (300 dpi). In those cases, we always make the higher resolution version available here on Flickr, too. We would love to make higher resolution versions (of the lower resolution copies) available some time in the future. Thanks again, Jill (U.S. National Archives)

comment.author: 39312862@N00
comment._content: Jill - yup, that's what I've noticed and I really REALLY am excited you're making the high resolution available. It sounds like if/when you re-scan the items scanned in the late 90s you'll make those available.
